page.title: 04WICKENBY:POPULATION JOBS.
page.content: The largest village of 58 houses and a population of 157.There are 40 residents under 18, 89 of working age and 28 retired. There is one church, a telephone exchange and a theatre converted from a former Methodist Chapel. There are 7 long established families in the village and 14 households connected with the land. Other occupations include teaching,engineering, coal merchants, haulage, social services, nursing, catering, secretarial and water and telephone services. Wickenby has held village festivities including teas,childrens' sports and dances on special occasions. A Candlelit Carol Service is held each year in the Church and a Harvest Supper after the Harvest Festival.
